008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch13_ColorImages;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * ImageJ plugin, continuously desaturates the current image directly in RGB
019 * color space (without conversion to HSV or HSB). The degree of desaturation is
020 * controlled by factor S in [0,1]. With S = 1, the image is unchanged, with S
021 * = 0 the resulting image is completely colorless (gray). See Sec. 13.2.2
022 * (Prog. 13.5) of [1] for details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
026 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 */
031public class Desaturate_RGB implements PlugInFilter {
032        
033        public static double S = 0.3; // color saturation factor
034
035        @Override
036        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
037                return DOES_RGB;
038        }
039        
040        @Override
041        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
042                
043                if (!runDialog()) {
044                        return;
045                }
046                
047                final int w = ip.getWidth();
048                final int h = ip.getHeight();
049                
050                //iterate over all pixels
051                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
052                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
053
054                                // get int-packed color pixel
055                                int c = ip.get(u, v);
056
057                                // disassemble RGB components from int color pixel
058                                int r = (c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
059                                int g = (c & 0x00ff00) >> 8;
060                                int b = (c & 0x0000ff);
061
062                                //compute equivalent gray value (luma, ITU BR.601 weights)
063                                double y = 0.299 * r + 0.587 * g + 0.114 * b;
064
065                                // linearly interpolate $(yyy) --> (rgb)
066                                r = clamp(y + S * (r - y));
067                                g = clamp(y + S * (g - y));
068                                b = clamp(y + S * (b - y));
069
070                                // reassemble color pixel to int
071                                c = ((r & 0xff) << 16) | ((g & 0xff) << 8) | b & 0xff; 
072                                ip.set(u, v, c);
073                        }
074                }
075        }
076        
077        private int clamp(double x) {
078                int z = (int) Math.round(x);
079                if (z < 0) return 0;
080                if (z > 255) return 255;
081                return z;
082        }
083        
084        private boolean runDialog() {
085                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
086                gd.addMessage("Saturates or desaturates the current image.");
087                gd.addNumericField("Saturation factor (S = 0..1)", S, 2);
088                
089                gd.showDialog();
090                if (gd.wasCanceled())
091                        return false;
092                
093                S = gd.getNextNumber();
094                if (S < 0) S = 0;
095                if (S > 1) S = 1;
096                return true;
097        }
098
099}
